intro: Hieracium oroelense, commonly known as the Oroel hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Hieracium oroelense is notable for its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
